title: Philip Lowe gets a banana republic moment of his own
text:
The world of Reserve Bank of Australia promotional videos was rocked to its core this week following a searingly honest portrayal by RBA governor Philip Lowe of the struggles and inner turmoil of a typical self-funded retiree in the face of the rapid decline in the value of his savings thanks to the policies of the RBA.

In the video, filmed entirely on location at a swanky fruit stall in Sydney’s elite Macquarie Street, Phil Lowe displays the matinee-idol looks, screen presence and acting abilities of Al Pacino, Paul Newman and Rob Lowe (no relation, but after seeing this performance that comes as a surprise) all rolled into one.

Critics have slammed Lowe’s performance as being “awkward”, but this is to misunderstand the deeper context of the film’s dark themes and the subtle nuances of despair and suppressed anger that Lowe has brought to his role as a typical self-funded retiree trying to survive on his meagre weekly savings, a role that interestingly required very little make-up or prosthetics but did require a great deal of rehearsal and workshopping.

The lights and cameras love Phil Lowe. Bloomberg

According to one film industry insider, when presented with the initial script, scribbled on the back of an envelope by the hot Hollywood script-writing duo Frydenberg & Cormann, Lowe expressed confusion about the specifics of the plot, reportedly saying: “Why am I using cash to buy a banana? My wife has them delivered every Friday morning from Vaucluse Gourmet Grocers. That’s the only place you can get those yummy little hand-picked ones specially flown in from Thailand.”

In order to prepare for the challenging role of the “typical Aussie self-funded retiree”, and employing the Stanislavski “method” approach to acting, Lowe spent several months “getting into character”. During the initial stage of his preparations. Lowe’s acting coach asked him to pretend that it was the late 1990s during the Howard years and that he was an ordinary bloke in his 40s with an ordinary job, but who spent his evenings fantasising with his wife about how they would spend their retirement “twilight” years.
description: The Oscar talk has started early with RBA governor Philip Lowe's searing portrayal of a self-funded retiree using cash to buy fruit.
